intro: Conopodium majus, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its roots contain alkaloids and have been used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
